treatment.reference: Methanococcus jannaschii sp. nov., an extremely thermophilic methanogen from a submarine hydrothermal vent Arch Microbiol 136:254-261
treatment.description: Irregular cocci measuring 1.5 µm in diameter, occuring singly or in pairs. Cells are osmotically fragile and easily lysed in low osmolal solutions. Single electron dense cell wall; surface is composed of hexagonally ordered substructures; cells are motile; two bundles of flagella insert near one pole. Colonies convex, circular, yellowish in color with a smooth shiny surface. DNA base composition 31 mol % G + C. Temperature optimum near 85 ˚C; range 50 – 85˚C. pH Optimum near 6.0; growth occurs at pH 5.2 to 7.0. Obligately anaerobic. H2/CO2 serve as substrate for growth and CH4 formation. Grows autotrophically in defined medium with H2/CO2. No growth was detected from formate, acetate, methanol, or methylamines. Acetate, formate, yeast extract, trypticase, vitamins were not required for growth or stimulatory. NaCl required for growth (optimal at 0.5 M Na+). Selenium stimulates growth. Sulfide is required. Isolated from sedimentary material at base of a "white smoker" submarine hydrothermal vent, East Pacific Rise, at a depth of 2,600 m. Type strain JAL-1 has been deposited in the German culture collection (DSM) Gottingen, FRG, number 2661.
